_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Great Bend Coop Executive Summary - Pawnee Rock Branch

Prepared By: Dennis D. Neeland



1. The Facility Policy

The Management and Employees are committed to the prevention of any type of accidental release of NH3 or any other chemical that is stored at the facility. Company policy and procedures are strictly followed when handling and storing NH3.



2. Facility Information

The NH3 facility is located directly east of the city limits. The facility has two storage tanks of 30,000 and 18,000 gallons which give a total capacity of 48,000 gallons.



3. The Worst Case and Alternate Release Scenario



Worst case scenario would release 131,070 pounds in a 10 minute period or 13,107 pounds per minute with a 1.1 mile to end point. Alternate release could involve a transfer hose rupture this would result in a release of 2900 pounds in a 2 minute period with a .22 mile to end point.



4. Accidental Release Prevention

The Great Bend Coop recognizes all safety regulations and procedures required by State and Federal Agencies and has annual training for the employees. The most common accidental release would be the overfilling of nurse trailers: An example would be a nurse trailer filled to 90% on a cool morning, as the air temperature rises, the product expands and causes the pressure relief valve to let product escape. Great Bend Coop Policy is not to fill above 85%.



5. Five Year Accident History

There has not been a reportable accident in the last five years.



6. Emergency Response Program

The Great Bend Coop has an Emergency Response Plan, Emergency Action Plan, and a Safety Director. All areas have worked with the County, City and Insurance Company Loss Control Department for the development of these plans.



7. Planned Safety Changes

The Company Safety Director, Operations Manager tour the Branch once per month  All areas are toured once a quarter. Changes are made on an as needed basis as new regulations or concerns arise.
